task.title: Grandma's French Toast
task.shortdesc: One of my first memories is of Grandma making us french toast in the kitchen whenever she came to visit. I know you love the recipe, so I wanted to include her and her memory in your cookbook for when you visit me here.

taskbody.prereq:
Make sure you have all the ingredients. You'll need:
6 large eggs
2 1/2 tablespoons orange-flavored liqueur
1 tablespoon sanding sugar, plus more for serving
Coarse salt
1 1/2 teaspoons finely grated orange zest plus 2 tablespoons juice
1 1/4 cups whole milk
6 tablespoons sunflower oil
3 tablespoons unsalted butter, plus more for serving
1 loaf brioche bread, cut into 1/2-inch slices
pure maple syrup for serving

step.cmd: Beat the eggs with a fork in a large, shallow dish.
Beat in the liquer, sugar, salt, orange juice and orange zest
Add milk and beat until combined.
Heat 4 tablespoons of sunflower oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until sizzling.
Dip the brioche bread, one slice at a time, into egg mixture, adding them to the skillet.
Cook until the brioche bread is golden brown on both sides.
